thread.title: Mix Diskerud joins Swedish side IFK Goteborg on loan
thread.title_full: Mix Diskerud joins Swedish side IFK Goteborg on loan

title: Mix Diskerud joins Swedish side IFK Goteborg on loan
text:
Mix Diskerud joins Swedish side IFK Goteborg on loan Brad Penner 0 Mar 10, 2017 15:31:08 After having his contract bought out by NYCFC, Major League Soccer has sent the Norwegian-American out on loan until Aug. 27, 2017. 
Former New York City FC midfielder Mix Diskerud has joined IFK Goteborg on loan, the MLS side announced Friday. 
Diskerud, a U.S. international, has agreed to join the Swedish club until Aug. 27, 2017. . @MixDiskerud joins @IFKGoteborg on loan through August 27, 2017. https://t.co/sH9TZVUaU2 — New York City FC (@NYCFC) March 10, 2017 
NYCFC bought out Diskerud's guaranteed contract last week, with each MLS club allowed to buyout one player's contract during the offseason to free up salary-cap space. 
The 26-year-old remains under contract with Major League Soccer. 
Sweden’s Allsvenskan league begins on April 1, and Diskerud will be with coach Jorgen Lennartsson's team throughout most of the MLS season. 
Diskerud signed with NYCFC ahead of its inaugural season in 2015. The Norwegian-American had four goals and three assists in 39 appearances in two years with the club
